Description: GlusterFS storage cluster CloudFormation template file.

AdminPubkeyURL.Description: (Optional) URL of file containing admin group's SSH public-keys

AmiId.Description: ID of the AMI to launch

BackupBucketName.Description: Name of S3 Bucket used to host Gluster backups

CloudWatchAgentUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to CloudWatch Agent installer. Example: s3://amazoncloudwatch-agent/linux/amd64/latest/AmazonCloudWatchAgent.zip

InstanceRoleName.Description: (Optional) IAM instance role to apply to the instance

InstanceRoleProfile.Description: (Optional) IAM instance-role profile to apply to the instance(s)

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances

ReplicaNum.Description: Number of replica.(1-9; 1 means no replica.)

RootVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the instance's root EBS volume.

SharedVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the EBS volume to create. Ignored if "SharedVolumeDevice" is blank

SharedVolumeType.Description: Type of EBS volume to create. Ignored if "SharedVolumeDevice" is blank

SecurityGroupIds.Description: List of security groups to apply to the instance(s)

SubnetList.Description: Subnets to which GlusterFS nodes may belong.

WatchmakerAdminGroups.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain groups that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAdminUsers.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain users that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAvailable.Description: Specify if Watchmaker is available (if "false" all other Watchmaker-related parms will be ignored).

WatchmakerComputerName.Description: (Optional) Sets the hostname/computername within the OS

WatchmakerConfig.Description: (Optional) URL to a Watchmaker config file

WatchmakerEnvironment.Description: Environment in which the instance is being deployed

WatchmakerOuPath.Description: (Optional) DN of the OU to place the instance when joining a domain. If blank and "WatchmakerEnvironment" enforces a domain join, the instance will be placed in a default container. Leave blank if not joining a domain, or if "WatchmakerEnvironment" is "false"

WatchmakerS3Source.Description: Flag that tells watchmaker to use its instance role to retrieve watchmaker content from S3

#!/bin/bash
# Script to configure an OS for use with Gluster
#
#################################################################
PROGNAME="$(basename "${0}")"
VOLNAME="${1:-vol01}"
VOLMOUNT="${3:-/var/glusterfs/${VOLNAME}}"
REPLCNT="replica ${2:-2}"
if [[ ${REPLCNT} =~ .*2 ]]
then
   FORCE="force"
fi

##
## Set up an error logging and exit-state
function err_exit {
   local ERRSTR="${1}"
   local SCRIPTEXIT=${2:-1}

   # Our output channels
   echo "${ERRSTR}" > /dev/stderr
   logger -t "${PROGNAME}" -p kern.crit "${ERRSTR}"

   # Need our exit to be an integer
   if [[ ${SCRIPTEXIT} =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]
   then
      exit "${SCRIPTEXIT}"
   else
      exit 1
   fi
}

# Create location to mount the created volume
printf "Creating %s... " "${VOLMOUNT}"
if [[ -d ${VOLMOUNT} ]]
then
   echo "Already exists"
else
   install -Ddm 0755 "${VOLMOUNT}" && echo "Success" || \
     err_exit "Failed creating ${VOLMOUNT}"
fi


sleep $[ ( ${RANDOM} %60 ) + ( ${RANDOM} %60 ) ]

# Find our peers
for HOST in $( cat /etc/glusterhosts )
do
   gluster peer probe ${HOST} || err_exit "Peer-probe failed for ${HOST}"
done

sleep 15

# Create a replicated volume
printf "Attempting to create %s... " "${VOLNAME}"
if [[ $(gluster volume info "${VOLNAME}" > /dev/null 2>&1 )$? -eq 0 ]]
then
   echo "Volume '${VOLNAME}' already exists"
else
   gluster volume create "${VOLNAME}" ${REPLCNT} \
      $( sed -r "s!( +|	+|$)!:${VOLMOUNT} !g" /etc/glusterhosts ) \
      ${FORCE} && echo "Success" || err_exit "Creation of '${VOLNAME}' failed"

   printf "Attempting to start %s... " "${VOLNAME}"
   gluster volume start "${VOLNAME}" || err_exit "Failed to start Gluster-volume '${VOLNAME}'"
fi

10-reboot.command: shutdown -r +2 "Rebooting so all config-options take effect..." &
